channel.title: Minecraft purchase issue
channel.description: Okay, I don't have a credit card or access to one that I can borrow at the moment, so I bought a Vanilla Visa gift card. I have never had a problem with one before until I tried to buy Minecraft. I validated the card with PayPal, they took the $1.50 off my card, I entered the code that I got, and works. Problem is, it works for everything EXCEPT buying Minecraft, which is really making me want to scream. I've looked at Vanilla Visa's FAQ's and I've contacted them for help. I have looked at PayPal's FAQ and contacted them for help. Both parties say they have no clue what's wrong and that I'm basically S.O.L. So I come to you. CAN SOMEONE HERE PLEASE HELP ME? I really want to buy the game.

item.title: Minecraft purchase issue
item.dc:creator: TheKnower
item.description:
bigfan421:

… Notch is 1. moving servers for the site…

  • Most people are successful in buying it.
  • Trying to buy it repeteatedly doesn’t help
  • Some percentage of people have never been able to buy minecaft. This has been true for years as you can see through google.

Therefore it is not due server relocation.

DethklokSoldier:

I’ve contacted them for help… Both parties say … I’m basically S.O.L.

Correct.

Its because:

  1. paypal has marked them as people who might ask for a refund. Possibly because they asked for a chargeback at some point in history.

  2. Unlike most sites, Mojang has their payapl integration set to the absolute maximum so it will reject anyone at the slightest cause. They may do this because little kids keep using their parents card and then the parents do a chargeback. They don’t want these kids or their parents. At any rate, any user who has ever asked for a single charge back in their lives, whether legitimate or not, will be rejected.

  • Paypal and moneybrokers share this information so using another system wont help.
  • You can not actually delete an account with either paypal or moneybrokers.
  • There is no way to complain about their erroneous rating of you or even see it (unless you create you own merchant account and set up a paypal integration and try to buy something from yourself (which what I do for a living))
  • Mojang is not going to change their policy and, since it’s like 5 guys, probably don’t remember they set it up this way. And anyway don’t care too much since it’s only a small percent of people.
DethklokSoldier:

So I come to you. CAN SOMEONE HERE PLEASE HELP ME? I really want to buy the game.

You could try to create a another account but if you use the same credit card number, email address, physical address or phone number you will be immediately tagged. Browser and flash cookies will also be used to tag you and maybe some paypal buggy heuristic magic

In fact:

  1. you will need someone else to buy it for you.
  2. paypal and money brokers need regulation and competition.
DethklokSoldier:

I don’t like giving any site access to my bank account, no matter how secure it claims to be. Call it paranoia, but I would rather be safe than sorry.

Theft is not the problem, the problem is that paypal has its own credit reporting system that is buggy, unregulated, secretive, un-deletable and not subject to appeal. The more info you give them, the sorrier you’ll be in the long run.
